name: UpdateSectionNameAsana
description:
Update the name of a specific section in Asana.

Use this tool to update the name of an existing section in an Asana project. It specifically changes the `name` field of a section without affecting other fields. Ideal for modifying section titles while preserving other data.

parameters.name: section_global_identifier
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for the section to be updated in Asana.

value_schema.description: The globally unique identifier for the section.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response. Allows inclusion of optional fields excluded by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: section_name
parameters.description: The new name for the section. It cannot be an empty string.

value_schema.description: The text to be displayed as the section name. This cannot be an empty string.

parameters.name: section_insert_before_id
parameters.description: The ID of an existing section in the project before which the updated section should be inserted. Cannot be provided with section_insert_after_id.

value_schema.description: An existing section within this project before which the added section should be inserted. Cannot be provided together with insert_after.

parameters.name: insert_after_section_id
parameters.description: Identifier of an existing section after which the updated section should be inserted. Cannot be used with `insert_before_section_id`.

value_schema.description: An existing section within this project after which the added section should be inserted. Cannot be provided together with insert_before.

parameters.name: pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true for a readable, pretty formatted response with line breaks and indentation. Recommended for debugging as it increases response size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: section_gid
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier for the section.

value_schema.description: The globally unique identifier for the section.

parameters.name: data.name
parameters.description: The text to be displayed as the section name. This cannot be an empty string.

value_schema.description: The text to be displayed as the section name. This cannot be an empty string.

parameters.name: data.insert_before
parameters.description: An existing section within this project before which the added section should be inserted. Cannot be provided together with insert_after.

value_schema.description: An existing section within this project before which the added section should be inserted. Cannot be provided together with insert_after.

parameters.name: data.insert_after
parameters.description: An existing section within this project after which the added section should be inserted. Cannot be provided together with insert_before.

value_schema.description: An existing section within this project after which the added section should be inserted. Cannot be provided together with insert_before.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
